extractions.description: The paper presents an empirical study analyzing the challenges faced by practitioners during the deployment of Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) systems, based on posts from Stack Overflow. The authors categorize 357 posts into a taxonomy of 31 unique challenges across deployment platforms including server/cloud, mobile/embedded system, browser, and game engine.

title.value: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges
title.justification: The title provides a clear and concise summary of the main focus of the paper, which discusses the challenges involved in the deployment of Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) systems.
title.quote: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges

type.justification: The paper is based on an empirical study conducted on Stack Overflow posts to uncover and understand the challenges faced by practitioners in deploying DRL systems.
type.quote: In this paper, we propose an empirical study on Stack Overflow (SO)...

research_field.justification: The research focuses on Deep Reinforcement Learning, which is a subfield of Deep Learning.
research_field.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (DRL), leveraging Deep Learning (DL) in reinforcement learning...

sub_research_field.justification: The specific focus of the research is on Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) systems and their deployment.
sub_research_field.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (DRL), leveraging Deep Learning (DL) in reinforcement learning...

name.justification: PyTorch is mentioned as a classical framework extensively used by practitioners for building DRL-based systems.
name.quote: Since many practitioners are still using classical DL frameworks such as Pytorch and TensorFlow to build DRL-based systems...

type.justification: PyTorch is a widely used deep learning framework for developing machine learning models.

name.justification: The entire study is based on analyzing the Stack Overflow data dump to collect posts related to DRL deployment.
name.quote: We download the SO dump from the official Stack Exchange Data Dump [37] on the 11th of October 2022. The dataset includes posts from July 2008...

name.justification: The library is mentioned as a popular framework that helps relieve the cost of building DRL solutions from scratch.
name.quote: Frameworks and libraries like Stable Baselines [8], Keras-RL [9], and TensorForce [10] are continually being released to relieve the cost of building DRL solutions from scratch.

name.justification: The library is mentioned as a popular framework that helps relieve the cost of building DRL solutions from scratch.

name.justification: TensorFlow Serving is mentioned as a tool that accelerates and facilitates the deployment of DRL systems.
name.quote: This approach offers developers tools and services like TensorFlow Serving [28] or Amazon Sagemaker [29] to accelerate and facilitate deployment.

name.justification: TF Lite is mentioned as a lightweight DL framework used to reduce the DNN footprint for deployment in mobile and embedded devices.
name.quote: To cope with limited edge platforms’ resources, lightweight DL frameworks, such as TF Lite [30] and Core ML [31], are built to reduce the DNN footprint.

name.justification: Core ML is mentioned as a lightweight DL framework used to reduce the DNN footprint for deployment in mobile and embedded devices.
name.quote: To cope with limited edge platforms’ resources, lightweight DL frameworks, such as TF Lite [30] and Core ML [31], are built to reduce the DNN footprint.

name.justification: Barracuda is mentioned as a package provided by Unity3d to enable the usage of DRL agents within games.
name.quote: Popular game engines, such as Unity3d, provide neural network inference packages (e.g., Barracuda [36]) that enable the usage of DRL agents within games.
